com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport
Class FilterInfo

java.lang.Object
  com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport.FilterInfo

public final class FilterInfo
extends Object

Information about how Items are to be processed during a filter operation.

Since:
2.0

Constructor Detail

FilterInfo

public FilterInfo(FilterBasis filterBasis,
                  FilterOperator filterOperator,
                  List<PropertyValue> values)
Constructs a new FilterInfo, initializing all mandatory fields.

Parameters:
filterBasis - A FilterBasis indicating what aspect of Items will be used as the basis for the filter operation.
filterOperator - A FilterOperator indicating the operator to be used in the filter operation.
values - The values to be compared with the aspect of the Items specified in filterBasis, using the operator specified in filterOperator. All values are transported as PropertyValues, but the appropriate number of values and their actual types depend on the operator:
  • FilterOperator.BETWEEN – A pair of numeric or date values, where the order of the values is not important
  • FilterOperator.EQUAL_TO – A single value of any type
  • FilterOperator.GREATER_THAN – A single numeric or date value
  • FilterOperator.GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO – A single numeric or date value
  • FilterOperator.LESS_THAN – A single numeric or date value
  • FilterOperator.LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO – A single numeric or date value
  • FilterOperator.SMART_MATCH – A single string value
  • FilterOperator.STARTS_WITH – A single string value
The documentation for CoreProperty describes the valid values for properties with different LogicalTypes. The documentation for FilterOperator describes restrictions on the values that can be used with some operators.
Method Detail

getFilterBasis

public FilterBasis getFilterBasis()
Gets the FilterBasis indicating what aspect of Items will be used as the basis for the filter operation.

Returns:
See above.

getFilterOperator

public FilterOperator getFilterOperator()
Gets the FilterOperator indicating the operator to be used in the filter operation.

Returns:
See above.

getPropertyTypeId

public String getPropertyTypeId()
Gets a String containing the identifier of the PropertyType on whose Propertys the Items are to be filtered.

Returns:
See above, or null if getFilterBasis() does not return FilterBasis.PROPERTY_TYPE.

setPropertyTypeId

public void setPropertyTypeId(String propertyTypeId)
Sets the PropertyType on whose Propertys the Items are to be filtered to the one with the specified identifier.

Parameters:
propertyTypeId - A String containing the identifier of the PropertyType to set. This method should only be called when getFilterBasis() returns FilterBasis.PROPERTY_TYPE.

getValues

public List<PropertyValue> getValues()
Gets PropertyValues containing the values to be used in the filter operation.

Returns:
See above.

getId

public String getId()
Gets a String containing the identifier of this FilterInfo.

An identifier is optional for a FilterInfo, except in the context of a NetworkSearchNodeList, when the identifier is mandatory.

Returns:
See above, or null if this FilterInfo has no identifier.
Since:
4.0

setId

public void setId(String id)
Sets the identifier of this FilterInfo to the specified String.

An identifier is optional for a FilterInfo, except in the context of a NetworkSearchNodeList, when the identifier is mandatory.

Parameters:
id - A String containing the identifier to set.
Since:
4.0
